alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued June 11 at 2:27PM PDT until June 13 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...A very cold airmass will create the chance of sub- freezing temperatures as low as 29 degrees possible. * WHERE...Portions of Modoc County in California including Alturas. In Oregon, portions Lake and Klamath Counties including Chiloquin, Chemult, Crescent, Silver Lake, Bly, Sprague River, Christmas Valley, and Beatty. It also includes the outskirts of Klamath Falls, Bonanza, and Lakeview. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Frost may also be possible for areas outside of the freeze warning depending on cloud cover. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Lake County; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
